Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge. The sides turn out sharply at the cutting edge to form two distinct cusps and the lugs are not so elongated. The piece is thickly corroded, and the cutting edge badly damaged.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (125)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
